p: Micropropagation is a robust and reliable technique used for the multiplication of plants through in vitro cultures; it produces many homogeneous plants in a short period. Besides, the production of bioactive secondary metabolites can be enhanced in medicinal plants with this technique ( Khan I. et al., 2020). During micropropagation, tiny parts of the plants commonly called explants excised from different plant species can be micro-propagated under optimized growth conditions of culture media, temperature, and photoperiod ( Abbasi et al., 2016).
